translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Kaṇikāra Flowers
The Story of the Elder Kāsumāraphalīya
Shining like a kaṇikāra flower,
sitting in the midst of the mountains;
I saw the dust-free Buddha,
the world’s chief, the bull among men.
With a confident and joyful mind,
raising my joined palms above my head;
taking a kāsumāra fruit,
I always served the best of Buddhas.
Thirty-one eons ago,
the fruit I offered then;
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of offering fruit.
My defilements are burned up,
I live without defilements.
How welcome it was for me
I have done what the Buddha asked.
The four analytical insights,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā kāsumāraphaliyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā kāsumāraphaliyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus the elder Kāsumāraphalīya recited these verses.
The story of the elder Kāsumāraphalīya is the third one.
